Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.screenwithsol

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import os
import time

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import CmdError

START_TIME = time.time()  # The start time of this python script/process.
# Use the PID and start time of this script as a unique screen name.
SCREEN_NAME = "solreplaytest%d%f" % (os.getpid(), START_TIME)
DEFAULT_SCRNLOG_NAME = "screenlog.0"


[docs]class ScreenWithSOL():


[docs]    def __init__(self, host, screenlog=DEFAULT_SCRNLOG_NAME,
                screen_name=SCREEN_NAME):
        self.host = host
        self.screenlog = screenlog
        self.screen_name = SCREEN_NAME



[docs]    def start_SOL_on_logged_screen_session(self):
        """
        Starts a screen session on a remote machine (a machine which is not
        the server under test) and activates the SOL session on it. The screen
        session has logging enabled, so all SOL output will be saved into
        a screen log file.

        Returns:
        The name of the screen log file.
        """
        # Create a screen, detached, with logging, with a specific name.
        self.host.localhost.run("screen -L -dmS %s" % (self.screen_name))
        # This screen cmd runs 'sol activate' in the specified secreen session.
        screen_cmd = (("screen -S %s -p 0 -X stuff \"ipmitool -I lanplus " +
            "-U USERID -P PASSW0RD -H %s sol activate `echo -ne '\015'`\"") %
            (self.screen_name, self.host.oob.oob_addr))
        self.host.localhost.run(screen_cmd)

        return self.screenlog



[docs]    def setup_cleanup(self):
        """
        This function is to be used in conjunction with
        start_SOL_on_screen_session(), if desired. Run this function before &
        after start_SOL_on_screen_session() for setup/cleanup purposes.
        """
        try:
            self.host.localhost.run("screen -S %s -X quit" % (self.screen_name))
        except CmdError:
            pass  # Ignore non-zero exit code if screen session doesn't exist.
        try:
            self.host.localhost.run("rm %s" % (self.screenlog))
        except CmdError:
            pass  # Ignore the non-zero exit code if screenlog doesn't exist
        try:
            self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd("sol deactivate")
        except CmdError:
            pass  # Ignore a non-zero exit code if already deactivated
